messages.title: Fixing the economy and investing in our NHS services
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats fought to increase investment in the NHS this financial year - and are campaigning for an extra £8 billion a year for the NHS. Worked to repair Britain's economy at the same time as delivering an £800 income tax cut for 25 million working people in Britain - that the Tories said could not be done.

messages.title: Only the Liberal Democrats will introduce the Mansion Tax to fund NHS and end pay freeze
messages.content: Only the Liberal Democrats will invest the £8 billion extra a year our NHS needs by 2020. Back their campaign for extra NHS funding.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: An extra £8 billion a year for the NHS by 2020, and to take those on minimum wage out of tax altogether.
Plans to make sure mental health is taken seriously with £1.25 billion of funding.
Ensure more money for school pupils from disadvantaged backgrounds.
Continue to make income tax fairer, taking those on minimum wage out of tax altogether.

issues.economy: Worked to repair Britain's economy and delivering an £800 income tax cut for 25 million working people in Britain.
issues.education: Ensure more money for school pupils from disadvantaged backgrounds.
issues.health: Fighting for an extra £8 billion a year for the NHS by 2020; mending the NHS by reversing the Tory NHS reorganisation; plans to make sure mental health is taken seriously with £1.25 billion of funding.

housing.content: Only the Liberal Democrats will introduce the Mansion Tax to fund NHS and end pay freeze.

contactInformation.address: Liberal Democrats, 8-10 Great George Street, London, SW1P 3AE
